definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
delivery time (time between ordering goods and receiving the delivery)/date of delivery
lit. one hand exchanges the cash, the other the goods (idiom)/fig. to pay for what you want in cash/simple and direct transaction
pinyin: yi1 shou3 jiao1 qian2 , yi1 shou3 jiao1 huo4

sentences.english: Sulfur or sulfuric deliveries can be similarly measured .
sentences.chinese: 硫黃和硫酸的交貨量也可用類似方法測定。

sentences.english: Invalidity: The invalidity of the contract is due to your unpunctual delivery of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 合同的失效是由於你方交貨不及時造成的。

sentences.english: We'll make delivery at once if I receive your order.
sentences.chinese: 收到定單後，我們將馬上交貨。

sentences.english: The blouses will be delivered in two consignments of 60,000 pieces each.
sentences.chinese: 這些女衫將分兩批交貨，每批六萬件。

sentences.english: The delivery deadline may act according to the actual situation arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 交貨期限可根據實際情況商訂。

sentences.english: I plant to high-quality, level price, short delivery time to win customers.
sentences.chinese: 我廠以高質量，平價格，交貨期短贏得客戶。

sentences.english: We request you to inform us of the price of Chinese dinnerware and the possibly earliest date of delivery.
sentences.chinese: 請告知中國產餐具的價格和最早的交貨日期。

sentences.english: I'll pay you a hundred dollars deposit and the remainder on delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我將付你一佰元定金，其餘款項在交貨時付訖。

sentences.english: I hope so. If I order now , when deliver?
sentences.chinese: 希望如此，如果現在定貨，什麼時候交貨。

sentences.english: Can you deliver the goods in the end of March if we make Whampoa the port of shipment.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們選擇黃埔港，你們能不能在三月底以前交貨？

sentences.english: On reinspection, we found that the quality of your shipment does not meet the contract standard.
sentences.chinese: 複檢，我們發現貴方交貨質量達不到合同規定標準。

sentences.english: Your L/C must reach us 3O days before delivery.
sentences.chinese: 你們一定要在交貨期前三十天把信用證開達我方。

sentences.english: If shipment were effected from HongKong, we could receive the goods much earlier.
sentences.chinese: 如果從香港交貨，我們收到貨物的時間便會早得多。

sentences.english: And all those companies are plagued by backed-up orders and delivery delays.
sentences.chinese: 而所有這些公司都苦於訂單堆積及交貨延誤。

sentences.english: Our order of leather shoes, which should have been delivered in June, is now considerably over due.
sentences.chinese: 我方訂購的皮鞋應在六月交貨，現已延誤多日。

sentences.english: We are sorry for the brief delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲交貨量短缺向貴公司致歉。

definition: private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
(of a sum of money etc) receivable
to order goods/to place an order
to take a customer's order/(of a taxi driver) to accept a booking/(of a delivery rider) to accept a delivery job
variant of 訂單|订单[ding4 dan1]
(international trade) documentation (e.g. a bill of lading)
